snippet: Bill de Blasio claimed his place as the 109th mayor of New York City, promising in his inaugural speech that the attention he gave to the subject of inequality while running for office was not merely rhetoric.
abstract: Bill de Blasio, whose fiery populism propelled his rise from obscure neighborhood official to the 109th mayor of New York, is sworn into office; pledges that his ambition for a more humane and equal metropolis will remain undimmed, saying the attention he gave to the subject of inequality while running for office was not merely rhetoric; de Blasio is the first liberal to lead City Hall in two decades.
lead_paragraph: Bill de Blasio claimed his place as the 109th mayor of New York City, promising in his inaugural speech that the attention he gave to the subject of inequality while running for office was not merely rhetoric.

headline.main: Taking Office, de Blasio Vows to Fix Inequity
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, Taking Office, Pledges to Fix Inequalities
